channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report X-2024030107
item.description:
Report X-2024030107

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-01
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER APPROACHED LEAKING PACKAGE FOLLOWING THE INSTRUCTIONS OF DECISTION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET. THE PACKAGE WAS WET BUT THERE WAS NO VISIBLE SPILL ON THE GROUND OR IN THE TRAILER. PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE DMP CAGE FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024030134
item.description:
Report X-2024030134

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: FORT WALTON
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AIR PACKAGE CONTENTS WERE INSPECTED DUE TO A PREVIOUS UNDECLARED SHIPMENT FOUND RECENTLY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED A ONE GALLON JUG OF CORROSIVE CWB SOLUTIONS GOLD ASSASSIN RTU CONCRETE CLEANER/DEGREASER. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024030163
item.description:
Report E-2024030163

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: WILLISTON
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Big Valley Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by RDX personnel in Williston, FL regarding the assistance with a (1) gallon spill of Sectagon K54 (UN3266,8,PG II). The product was released from a poly tote onto the trailer floor at a terminal. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of Sectagon K54. Contractors were able to clean and neutralize the release with ABZORBIT PREMIUM ABSORBENT and the proper PPE. All waste generated was containerized in (1) 55- gallon poly drum which was taken off-site for proper disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2024030041

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-08T18:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: WET PACKAGE WITH HAZMAT SHIPPING PAPERS AND A FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIMAOND LABEL WAS FOUND ON THE IREG BELT BY THE SUPERISOR. TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP AREA USING THE HAZMAT PUSHCART. RESPONDER PROCESSED THE PACKAGE THROUGH THE DMP WHILE WEARING GOOGLES, BOOTS, ARPON AND GLOVES.

item.title: Report X-2024021784
item.description:
Report X-2024021784

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived to station punctured and placed in hazmat been for further inspection. Upon inspection the bottom of the box was wet because 4 bottles of Calci-Solve had loose caps and punctured seals causing minimal leakage. The 4 bottles of Calci-Solve were tightly packed with no inner protection. DescribePack: 4 gallons of Calci-Solve had loose caps and punctured seals causing them to leak. There was minimal leakage between all 4 gallons of Calci-Solve. All bottles of are still completely full. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in hazmat bag and bin then placed in Hazmat drum.

item.title: Report X-2024021772
item.description:
Report X-2024021772

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WET BOX DISCOVERED DURING PRELOAD SORT. BOX WAS BAGGED AND TAKEN TO DAMAGED HAZMAT CAGE. UPON INSPECTION DISCOVERED LOOSE CAPS ON BOTTLES, CAUSING CONTENTS TO LEAK. BOX AND CONTENTS WERE BAGGED AND PLACED IN SALVAGE DRUM. DescribePack: LOOSE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: BOX WAS BAGGED AND PLACED IN DAMAGED HAZMAT CAGE

  • Description: SequenceEvent: While a trailer was being unloaded, it was discovered that the package in question was leaking. The package was placed in a double-lined hazmat bin and moved to a well-ventilated area. DescribePack: Loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a double-lined hazmat bin and moved to a well-ventilated area.

item.title: Report X-2024021909
item.description:
Report X-2024021909

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-13
  • City: RIVIERA BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SUSPECTED SHIPMENT OF UNDECLARED HAZMAT (MISSING REQUIRED OUTER MARKINGS ON PACKAGE). INSTRUCTED TO AUDIT AND HOLD AT HUB AT HUB PENDING INVESTIGATION. DAY TWO OF AUDIT FOUND APPROXIMATELY 252 PACKAGES CONTAINING VARIOUS AMMUNITION. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON ANY OF THE OUTER PACKAGES. ADDITIONALLY, RESPONDER DISCOVERED THE PACKAGE WEIGHT ON EACH BOX IS 1 POUND, BUT THE ACTUAL WEIGHTS ARE MUCH GREATER THAN 1 POUND.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler was unloading in door 21 and noticed powder leaking from the package and notified manager. DescribePack: Package handler didn't use hand to surface which caused the package to fall to the floor. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We placed the package inside a bag and then inside hazmat material tote.

item.title: Report X-2024021901
item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: RIVIERA BEACH

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SUSPECTED SHIPMENT OF UNDECLARED HAZMAT (MISSING REQUIRED OUTER MARKINGS ON PACKAGE). INSTRUCTED TO AUDIT AND HOLD AT HUB AT HUB PENDING INVESTIGATION. APPROXIMATELY 301 PACKAGES IN THREE PALLETS FOUND CONTAINING VARIOUS AMMUNITION. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON ANY OF THE PACKAGES. PACKAGES SHIPPING FROM TOTAL GUN AMMUNITION (TGA) 1460 N JOG RD, WEST PALM BEACH FL 33411. RESPONDER DISCOVERED ADDITIONALLY, THE PACKAGE WEIGHT ON EACH BOX IS 1 POUND, BUT THE ACTUAL WEIGHTS ARE MUCH GREATER THAN 1 POUND, 11.5 POUNDS.

item.title: Report X-2024021737
item.description:
Report X-2024021737

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet & torn. Upon inspection found a plastic bag with 1 bottle of PH-Down 1-gallon was crushed & had loose lid resulted leakage & stain other 3 bottles. Contents were a corrosive hazmat material but is undeclared due to having no hazmat marking or certificate attached to outer package. DescribePack: Bottle was crushed & had loose lid resulted leakage & stain other 3 bottles. Contents were a corrosive hazmat material but no hazmat marking or certificate were attached to outer package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024021799
item.description:
Report X-2024021799

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Oxidizer & Corrosive hazmat package was found wet. Upon inspection found a plastic bag with 1 bottle of Rapicide PA part A 5-liters was leaking due to a defective lid. The lid was secured but was leaking out of a small manufactured hole that was part of the top of lid. DescribePack: Bottle was leaking due to a defective lid. The lid was secured but was leaking out of a small manufactured hole that was part of the top of lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote

item.title: Report X-2024021835
item.description:
Report X-2024021835

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was coming from the 200 NC inductor when the tugger noticed it was leaking. Upon noticing, the tugger let the QA know about the package, QA then removed the package away from the package handlers. DescribePack: The cap on one of four plastic bottles was not sealed properly and caused internal leakage of the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Alertness of the package by the tugger and getting the package away from the package handlers

DescribePack: INSPECTION FOUND A PUNCTURE IN THE DRUM THAT WAS ALLOWING LEAKAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: DRUM PLACED IN TOTE, TIPPED TO PREVENT MORE LEAKAGE

  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO RESPOND TO A WET PKG. RESPONDER DONNED ALL PPE AND FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET TO CLEAN UP AND PROCESS THRU PROPER DMP PROCEDURES.

item.title: Report X-2024021361
item.description:
Report X-2024021361

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived already wet to the station, then it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: Contents are Increte High Performance Epoxy Part A and Part B. Both cans leaked from loose lids. The Part B is the hazardous one and it leaked approximately 5 ounces. Part A is non hazardous and it released approximately 5 ounces too. Both cans had paint clips. Insufficient bubble wrap was used. Too much empty space was left inside the box. Part B size is 40 ounces and Part A size is 80 ounces. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon arrival of the wet package, it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment. No release was found.
